intro: Comesperma lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of Australian flora.
